qas.question: What did the US ask of Britain in May 1940?
What did the Destroyers for Bases Agreement do?

answers.text: granted the US base rights in Bermuda

qas.question: What was one thing the UK wanted in return for granting access to Bermuda?

answers.text: the airfield the US Army built would be used jointly by the US and the UK

qas.question: Who was the Prime Minister who reached this agreement with the US?
When did the US request base rights from Bermuda?

plausible_answers.text: the UK granted the US base rights in Bermuda

qas.question: Where did RAF Transport Command relocate from in 1934?

context: In <b4_0>May 1940<b4_0/>, the US requested <a0_0>base rights in Bermuda<a0_0/> from the United Kingdom, but <b5_0>British Prime Minister<b5_0/> <a3_0>Winston Churchill<a3_0/> was initially unwilling to accede to the American request without getting something in return. In September 1940, as part of the Destroyers for Bases Agreement, <b6_0>the UK <a1_0>granted the US base rights in Bermuda<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Bermuda and Newfoundland were not originally included in the agreement, but both were added to it, with no war material received by the UK in exchange. One of the terms of the agreement was that <a2_0>the airfield the US Army built would be used jointly by the US and the UK<a2_0/> (which it was for the duration of the war, with <b7_0>RAF Transport Command<b7_0/> relocating there from <b8_0>Darrell's Island<b8_0/> in 1943).
